story.iWant: define and prioritize the core feature set for the SpeedLink MVP
story.soThat: development efforts are focused on delivering essential functionality within the 1-week timeline
story.tasks: - Task 1: Review comprehensive requirements and categorize features (AC: 1, 4) - Task 2: Assess technical complexity and dependencies (AC: 2, 3, 5) - Task 3: Define MVP scope and document feature specifications (AC: 1, 6) - Task 4: Validate feasibility and finalize scope (AC: 7)

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. MVP feature list is documented with clear scope boundaries 2. Each MVP feature includes implementation complexity estimate (S/M/L/XL) 3. Feature dependencies and critical path are identified 4. Non-MVP features are clearly separated for future releases 5. MVP feature list aligns with technical architecture constraints 6. Feature list includes acceptance criteria for each MVP component 7. Resource allocation and timeline feasibility is validated

doc.title: SpeedLink Requirements Specification
doc.snippet: Comprehensive functional requirements including party/group mode, real-time map, speed camera alerts, community reporting, route navigation, privacy controls, messaging, emergency features, ride profiles, and weather alerts.

doc.title: SpeedLink Technical Architecture Overview
doc.snippet: Architecture defines PWA frontend, real-time backend with ≤800ms latency, REST API, database, notification service, moderation tools, and 3rd-party integrations using React/Vite, Node.js/Socket.IO, PostgreSQL/Redis stack.

doc.title: SpeedLink Project Brief
doc.snippet: Executive summary and objectives for ultra-low-latency PWA targeting motorcycle riders and drivers. Defines 10 core features including party mode, real-time map, alerts, community reporting, navigation, privacy, messaging, SOS, profiles, and weather.

doc.title: SpeedLink MVP Epics
doc.snippet: Planning & Architecture epic defines MVP features, technology stack selection, and system architecture design as foundational work for the 7-week development roadmap.

doc.title: MVP Development Roadmap
doc.snippet: Epic breakdown showing Planning & Architecture, Design & Setup, Core Feature Development, Alerts & Community, Navigation & Messaging, Testing & Polish, and Finalize & Release phases.

story-context.constraints: - Ultra-low-latency requirement: ≤800ms for party updates - PWA must support offline functionality and installability - System must handle 1000+ concurrent parties at scale - All communication must be encrypted (HTTPS/WSS) - GDPR-compliant data handling required - Battery optimization for background location updates - 1-week MVP timeline constraint for ruthless prioritization - No app store dependencies - web-based deployment only

tests.standards: No existing testing framework - will be established during scaffolding phase. Testing standards should include unit tests, integration tests for real-time functionality, performance tests for latency requirements, and PWA compliance tests.

ideas.idea: Test MVP feature list documentation completeness and clarity
Validate complexity estimates against actual implementation time
Test dependency mapping accuracy through implementation
Test resource allocation against actual development velocity
